critique: This document primarily concerns the financial compensation and allowances for enlisted military personnel. It does not directly address ideological issues, immigration, or civil liberties. It does delegate some authority to department heads, but this is within a specific context of managing allowances and doesn't represent a broad expansion of executive power. The document does not seem to obviously favor states or the federal government. It has a very slight interventionist economic impact, but it is mostly just dealing with pay. It does not seem to have any impact on social inclusion.
